Question: When major project priorities shift, how often do you help align timelines between multiple teams?
How often do you anticipate how a change in one team may affect another and communicate early?
When people feel uncertain about shifting goals, how often do you support them calmly and constructively?
How often do you keep momentum when inter-team dependencies are disrupted?
When senior direction changes, how often do you restate the new priorities clearly for everyone involved?
How often do you seek ideas or learnings from teams outside your domain?
How often do you share lessons learned from your project that help other groups avoid the same errors?
How often do you translate key project learnings into simple team checklists or playbooks?
When a process improves, how often do you broadcast that success so other teams can adopt it?
How often do you encourage others to share new learnings in cross-team retrospectives?
How often do you modify your approach when a solution from one team fails elsewhere?
When priorities clash between projects, how often do you help re-sequence work collaboratively?
How often do you apply insights from unrelated past experiences to a new situation?
How often do you balance following process with creative experimentation?
When plans shift mid-execution, how often do you refocus everyone on achievable next steps?
When something fails across teams, how often do you acknowledge it openly and share takeaways?
How often do you turn a setback into a group learning opportunity?
When feedback reveals a gap, how often do you adapt your plan immediately?
How often do you document what didn’t work and circulate it as a “lessons learned” note?
When others struggle after a setback, how often do you help them re-focus and move forward?
How often do you show curiosity about expertise outside your area?
How often do you volunteer for projects beyond your comfort zone?
When guiding others, how often do you coach them on staying open-minded during change?
When major transitions occur, how often do you remain composed and optimistic?
How often do other teams view you as a dependable, resilient learner who adapts gracefully?
Do I help others stay productive during change?
Do I learn from failures and share those lessons openly?
Do I show resilience when plans from other teams shift?
Do I seek learning from teams outside my own?
Do I help document and standardize team lessons so others benefit beyond my group?
How often do you translate organizational priorities into shared functional goals for all teams?
How often do you clarify inter-team dependencies before delivery starts?
When priorities conflict, how often do you facilitate a transparent decision on trade-offs?
How often do you re-communicate goal changes so every team knows its impact?
How often do you ensure success measures for each team connect to the functional scorecard?
How often do you delegate accountability along with authority and context?
How often do you coach team leads to own results instead of tasks?
How often do you trust leaders to manage risks without micromanagement?
When errors occur, how often do you focus on learning instead of blame?
How often do you encourage peer-level accountability between teams?
How often do you use shared dashboards to show progress across teams?
How often do you run open review sessions to surface blockers early?
How often do you escalate risks with evidence and impact analysis?
How often do you validate that status updates are complete and accurate?
How often do you keep cross-team dependencies visible in planning and reviews?
When resources shift, how often do you re-prioritize while keeping commitments intact?
How often do you model calm and balance when delivery pressure rises?
How often do you accept responsibility for cross-team delays before blaming external factors?
How often do you redirect teams from defensiveness to joint problem-solving?
How often do you ensure functional outcomes stay on track during crisis management?
How often do you create safe spaces for teams to report issues honestly?
How often do you acknowledge transparent behaviour in public forums?
How often do you address conflicts fairly to protect mutual trust?
How often do you verify data accuracy before sharing externally?
How often do you model integrity by owning results for the entire function?
Do I make ownership visible beyond my team?
Do middle managers know what they own and what they support?
Are cross-team risks surfaced early and factually?
Do I reward transparency as much as results?
How do I personally model functional integrity?
When multiple teams are involved, how often do you ensure your updates reach all groups, not just your own?
When presenting to both technical and non-technical groups, how often do you adapt your language accordingly?
How often do you verify that different teams have the same understanding of a message or update?
How often do you proactively prevent silos by sharing your team’s progress with other groups?
How often do you clarify your team’s role and responsibilities within the larger project/program so others see the big picture?
How often do you present ideas in a way that appeals to the needs of multiple teams?
How often do you frame benefits in terms of shared outcomes (time saved, conflicts avoided, value created across teams)?
How often do you use data/examples to persuade groups who may be hesitant?
How often do you build alignment by encouraging agreement among diverse stakeholders?
How often do you respond to respectful pushback from other teams with openness instead of defensiveness?
When communication breaks down between teams, how often do you step in to clarify misunderstandings?
How often do you help teams with different goals realign toward a shared outcome?
How often do you keep a respectful tone even during heated discussions?
How often do you redirect conversations back to shared priorities instead of individual team interests?
How often do you facilitate consensus in cross-team forums (e.g., joint reviews, project boards)?
How often do you choose the right platform (chat/email/meeting) to reach multiple groups efficiently?
How often do you provide structured updates (bulletins, highlights) so wide audiences can quickly follow?
After cross-team meetings, how often do you circulate a summary of decisions to all teams involved, not just your own?
In hybrid or distributed forums, how often do you ensure remote colleagues are included and heard equally?
How often do you simplify long updates into essential highlights for multi-team visibility?
How often do you confidently represent your team’s perspective in multi-team forums?
How often do you encourage peers or juniors to present updates in cross-team settings?
How often do you model transparency by sharing both successes and challenges openly across functions?
How often do you seek feedback from other teams on whether your updates were clear and useful?
How often do you build a reputation as a communicator that multiple teams can rely on for clarity?
Do I adapt my style when addressing my team vs multiple teams?
Do I actively bridge misalignments between functions?
Do other teams see me as a collaborative bridge or just a representative of my own group?
Do I include remote colleagues fairly in cross-team discussions?
Am I trusted as a transparent and reliable communicator across groups?

How often do you use tools (shared boards, async docs) to bridge time zones and functions?
After inter-team discussions, how often do you circulate updates accessible to all groups?
How often do you prevent one team from dominating hybrid meetings by balancing airtime?
How often do you create visibility into contributions from all teams so effort is fairly recognized?

How often do you mentor or support juniors in contributing to multi-team initiatives?
